body.u: And let's imagine if the tables were turned. (Re: Francine and Albert). Suppose a number of white families started marching into their commun - ? Well, actually, that might to be to their advantage, but - (Continues.)
Karl.
- you do see my point.
Need you to stop now.
Sorry.(Beat.) Maybe not handled with the - (Continues.)
It's all right.
- utmost delicacy.
But maybe time to let it drop.

stage.emph: Pause. In the near distance a church bell begins to ring.

body.u: (quietly looking at his watch.) Is it four o'clock?
Well, Russ, if I might -
Nope. Nope.
If I could just say this:
No. Karl?
Well, if you'd let me -
No. No more.
Uhhh... (Chuckling.) Bev? I get the impression your husband is telling me I'm not permitted to speak.
Don't think it's a good idea.
Well, Russ, I'm going to ask you at least to keep an open -?
Karl! What'd I just ask you?
Well, I think you're being a tad unreasonable.
Well, I think we've reached the end of this particular discussion.
Is that right?
Afraid it is.
Just like that.
Just like that.
Then what about this:
Well, I believe the Constitution endows me with a right to speak.
Well, then you can go and do that in your own home.
Bev...? (Laughs.) He's not being serious, is he?
Karl?
(laughs.) Am I being silenced?
Not going to ask you again.
Well, this is a new experience for me.
So be it.
(shakes his head) A real shame. For all concerned.
Well, that's the way things go sometimes.
Apparently so.
Anyway. Appreciate you stopping by.
I see.
Betsy, too.
Very well.
Kaaaaahhhh?
Okay then? Okay.

stage.emph: Silence. Karl stands and moves toward Betsy. They slowly exit through the open door.

body.u: (quietly as they exit) Kaahhh, whaah happaaahh?

stage.emph: But Karl immediately returns, Betsy following.

body.u: However:
(quietly) Karl, don't.

(very slowly, carefully) I don't imagine that... this particular family are entirely aware of why they've found such an agreeable price for the property. Don't suppose they know that aspect of it, do they? And let's say someone was to inform them of those facts. Let's say that was to happen.
(chuckles dangerously) Really don't know when to quit, do ya?
Because I think that might be an interesting conversation to have.
(beat, then to Bev) So I'll be seeing you on Mon-
(maintaining control) Well, Karl? You go ahead and do what you think is right, but I'll tell you one thing: what you're going to do right now is - (Continues.)
(overlapping) Well, I have a responsibility to the community as a whole. I can't afford to - (Continues.)
- you're going to take yourself right through that door and out of this house.
(overlapping) - simply pursue my own selfish interests.
(maintaining calm) Man, what a son of a bitch.
Russ, don't.
(to Karl) If you honestly think I give a rat's ass about the goddamn - (Continues.)
(overlapping) Okay. Okay.
- what, ya mean the community where every time I go for a haircut, where they all sit and stare like the goddamn Grim Reaper walked in the barber-shop door? That community? (Continues.)
(overlapping) My wife is two weeks away from giving birth to a child.
Where, Bev stops at Gelman's for a quart of milk and they look at her like she's got the goddamn plague? That the community I'm supposed to be looking out for?
A community with soon-to-be-children.
The Apostle Matthew -
(to Jim) Oh no no no. I'm talking now.
(to Francine and Albert) I am ashamed of every one of us.
(tugging at Karl's sleeve) Kaaaaah?
Betsy, wait in the car.

Well, you go right ahead and you tell those folks whatever you want, Karl. And while you're at it why don't you tell 'em about everything the community did for my son. I mean Jesus Christ, Murray Gelman even goes and hires a goddamn retarded kid, but my boy? Sorry. No work for you, bub.
People were frightened, Russ.

(contemptuous) Ahh, of what? He was gonna snap? Gonna go and kill another bunch of people? Send him off to defend the goddamn country, he does like he's told only to find out the kinda sons of bitches he's defending?
(forthright) He did not do the things they claimed he did. He would never -

Ah, for Christ's sake. What do you think happens in a goddamn war? They told him to secure the territory, not go knocking on doors asking permission. And if he was man enough to admit what he did, maybe you oughta have the decency to do the same damn thing.
(turning to Francine for support) You remember. Francine remembers what he was like.

p.emph: Russ makes a sound of disgust and goes to the footlocker. Under the following, he unlocks and opens the lid.

body.u: How he loved to read and think. That's just the kind of boy he was, wasn't it?
Yes, ma'am.

p.emph: Russ has produced an evelope from the footlocker. He steps forward, removing the letter - on yellow legal paper.

body.u: Here you go, Karl. Let's read all a little something, shall we?
What are you -?
(reading) Dear Mom and Dad.
(realising)Stop it!!!
(reading) I know you'll probably blame yourselves -
(standing, losing it completely) Russ, stop it stop it stop stop stop it!!!!
Russ. Don't.
(to Russ) I think you're unstable, Russ. I really do.

u.emph: You see what this is like? You see?
Well, I refuse to live this way any longer!!

p.emph: She goes into the bathroom and slams the door behind her.

body.u: (starting over calmly) Dear Mom and Dad.
Russ?

u.emph: I know you'll probably blame yourselves for what I've done -

body.u: Need you to calm down.
And you can go fuck yourself.
Well, that is over the line, mister. That is not langugae I will tolerate in front of my wife.

So here's what I'll do for you, Karl: make ya ten copies of this, you can hand 'em out at Rotary. Or better yet. Put it in the newsletter. Rotary News: Kid comes back from Korea, goes upstairs and wraps an extension cord around his neck. Talk that over at the lunch buffet next week.
(barely audible) Kaahhh?

And Francine walking in at nine in the morning to find him there. You be my guest, Karl. You go ahead and tell those people what kind of house they're moving into and see if that stops 'em, because I'll tell you what, I don't give a shit if a hundred Ubangi tribesman with a bone through the nose overrun this goddamn place, cuz I'm through with all of you, ya motherfucking sons of bitches. Every one of you.

p.emph: All stand in silence. We can hear Bev crying from behind the bathroom door. Russ slowly folds the letter.
